definition: to return empty-handed/to fail to win anything
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)

to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor

sentences.chinese: 最後只有五個家庭空手而歸。

sentences.english: No one shall appear before me empty-handed.
sentences.chinese: 任何人都不應出現在我面前空手而歸。

sentences.english: The door of grace is always open for her petitions, and they never return empty-handed.
sentences.chinese: 恩典之門總爲她的懇求而開，懇求者也永不空手而歸。

sentences.english: Mr. Shields didn't leave empty-handed, however.
sentences.chinese: 不過希爾茲也沒有空手而歸。

sentences.english: From Your temple, no one returns empty-handed.
sentences.chinese: 從你的寺廟沒有人空手而歸。

sentences.english: A good haggler knows when to walk away empty-handed.
sentences.chinese: 砍價好手清楚什麼時候空手而歸。

sentences.english: They go back to the house empty-handed, and Magan's little brother is gloating.
sentences.chinese: 他們空手而歸，馬江的弟弟有點幸災樂禍。
空手而歸這是我丈夫的朋友。

sentences.english: Dozens of others went empty-handed, Reuters reported.
sentences.chinese: 據路透社報道，許多人都空手而歸。

sentences.english: But they are bound to be disappointed.
sentences.chinese: 可是，他們必定空手而歸。
